thread.title: Arsenal fan takes ‘Wenger-out’ sign to anti-Donald Trump march as he takes fight against boss to whole new level
thread.title_full: Arsenal fan takes ‘Wenger-out’ sign to anti-Donald Trump march as he takes fight against boss to whole new level

author: arichardson
title: Arsenal fan takes ‘Wenger-out’ sign to anti-Donald Trump march as he takes fight against boss to whole new level
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A DISGRUNTLED Arsenal fan has gone to new lengths to demonstrate his frustration by taking a ‘Wenger Out’ sign to an anti-Donald Trump rally. 
Thousands marched to Westminster in protest at the US President’s state visit to the UK — with many unhappy at affording him such an honour following his highly controversial ‘Muslim Ban’. Getty Images 4 Arsene Wenger has come under serious fire in recent weeks as ‘Wenger Out’ brigade grows 
Trump is due to meet Prime Minister Theresa May and the Queen when he arrives, and protesters want the visit to be downgraded. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
But for one Gooner, it was just a chance to take his protest against Arsene Wenger to a new and wider audience. 
The Arsenal boss has come under serious fire in recent weeks following heavy and ‘expected’ defeats at Chelsea and Bayern Munich . 
Fans have been split over the Frenchman for a number of years due to his 12 seasons without a Premier League title and seeming inability to compete with his rivals. 
But with no signs of improvement, the anti-Wenger brigade has grown louder and there are more fans turning against him. Twitter Thousands descend on Westminster to protest the state visit of Donald Trump Twitter A closer look at the signs show one Arsenal fan holding up ‘Wenger Out’ Related Stories price of silva Manchester United have secret first option to sign Monaco's Bernardo Silva ahead of Chelsea and City Preview Manchester City vs Monaco: When is the Champions League tie and what TV channel is it on? Team news Manchester City vs Monaco team news: Vincent Kompany OUT, Pep Guardiola still to decide Claudio Bravo or Willy Caballero FOOTBALL FOR ALL Champions League could make terrestrial TV return as Channel 4 bids for rights to three-year deal Lor Welcome Arsenal to open talks with Napoli star Lorenzo Insigne after sending scouts to watch him in action Getty Images 4 Bayern Munich’s 5-1 win over Arsenal saw ‘Wenger Out’ brigade grow louder 
A supporter was even spotted among the 700 Gunners in attendance for the FA Cup fifth-round victory over Sutton with a sign calling for the manager to go. 
Wenger has been boss of Arsenal for 20 years, having arrived in 1996. 
In his first full season, he won a Premier League and FA Cup double and repeated the feat four years later, before adding another title in 2004. 
However, Arsenal have not been crowned champions since. Theo Walcott signs Sutton players’ shirts in dressing room after Arsenal FA Cup win
